attachments.title: Google Made a Tiny Programmable Choir Out of 300 Android Devices
attachments.text: Google Japan wanted to draw attention to a little Android app called Androidify, which makes tiny android avatars. So, it synchronized 300 Android devices, each with their own little avatar, to create a tiny android avatar chorus.
attachments.fallback: AdWeek: Google Made a Tiny Programmable Choir Out of 300 Android Devices

text: That is an excellent use of hundreds of Androids together
That's related to what I was thinking for mosiac - sound performance.

Who knew Netflix' streaming service had so many awesome films about design.  I've seen a handful of these over the years and they are always fascinating (and obviously directly connected to Uncorked's reason for being): <http://www.fastcodesign.com/3041441/22-movies-every-designer-should-watch-on-netflix>

attachments.title: 22 Movies Every Designer Should Watch On Netflix
attachments.text: In search of some inspiration? Then we have the movies for you!
